citeinfo.origin: National Bureau of Surveying and Mapping (NBSM)
citeinfo.title: Hypsography - Elevation Points (Digital Map Database of China)

pubinfo.publish: National Bureau of Surveying and Mapping (NBSM)

descript.abstract: Point layer which depicts elevation points in meters above sea level and degenerate contours throughout China. Polygons less than 1.5 square millimeters in circumference on the source map are represented as points.
descript.purpose: This data is intended for researchers, students, and policy makers for reference and mapping purposes, and to provide users with geographic data for cartographic and other types of geographic analysis.Data may be useful for earth science analysis, topographic reference or display and analysis of terrain elevations, or may be used with geographic information systems (GIS) software to provide a basemap to support graphical overlays and analysis with other spatial data

idinfo.accconst: Access is granted to licensee (Harvard University) only.

cntorgp.cntorg: National Bureau of Surveying and Mapping (NBSM)

idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows NT Version 4.0 (Build 1381) Service Pack 6; ESRI ArcCatalog 8.2.0.700

attracc.attraccr: Contour lines are irregular. Line intervals are 50 meters, 200 meters and 500 meters where the terrain is under 500 meters in elevation. Above 500 meters, the interval is 500 meters. 100 meter supplementary contour lines are added in some tiles.

dataqual.logic: Coincident Features:There are coincident features in the DMDC datalayers. For example, streams and coastlines coincide with boundaries.Minimum Areal Features:When the area of a polygon is less than 1.5 square millimeters on the 1:1,000,000-scale map, it is represented as a point feature and its code remains the same.

horizpa.horizpar: Line Connectivity and Polygon Closure:Some linear and polygonal features that do not contain the necessary connectivity in the original 1:1,000,000-scale map are connected in the DMDC. For example, roads are connected in DMDC when they are split by symbols or place names on the map, and double-line streams are closed in DMDC where they meet the ocean.Edgematching:Generally features along tile edges have been matched. However, in some cases no edgematching was attempted because the original 1:1,000,000-scale maps were compiled in different periods and severe feature offsets do occur. For example, this offset can be found in some vegetation features and 100-meter supplementary contours.

citeinfo.origin: National Bureau of Surveying and Mapping (NBSM)
citeinfo.title: 1:1,000,000 Scale Topographic Map of China

pubinfo.publish: National Bureau of Surveying and Mapping (NBSM)

citeinfo.othercit: Each map sheet covers six degrees longitude by four degrees latitude.The 1:1,000,000-scale map series is the smallest National Essential Topographic Map Series in China, which comprehensively depicts the natural, social and economic situation in China and forms a relevant geographic base for many uses.

procstep.procdesc: The production process included preparation, digitization, editing, establishment of typology, input of attributes, projection transformation, edge matching, code conversion and creation of the database. Each step was verified. The data production was finished in the environment of a VAX mini-computer using ARC/INFO 4.0. Features such as hydrography and hypsography were scanned using a Tektronix 4991 scanner. Other features were manually digitized using Calcomp 9100 digitizing boards.After the edge-matching process, all data were moved to a SUN SPARC processing environment using ARC/INFO 7.0. Then the attributes were translated from temporary code to the national standard code according to "Classifications and Codes of National Land Information." Readjustments and further editing of some codes and layers were performed when necessary.After the transformation of coordinates to the geographic coordinate system, the data was entered into the final database.

cntorgp.cntorg: National Bureau of Surveying and Mapping (NBSM)

procstep.procdesc: The original shape file was imported to an ArcSDE Layer.

altsys.altenc: Explicit elevation coordinate included with horizontal coordinates

depthsys.depthem: Explicit depth coordinate included with horizontal coordinates

enttyp.enttypd: ESRI Shapefile. Points describe elevation points in meters above sea level

attr.attrdef: Internally calculated feature area in map units.
Internally calculated feature perimeter in map units.

edom.edomvd: Degenerate contour line in snow area

attrvai.attrvae: The point for a degenerate contour line is captured at the center of the area outlined by the contour line

attr.attrdef: The SHAPE attribute defines the vector data as either a point, polyline, or polygon

edom.edomvd: A point represents a single location, usually identified by longitude-latitude, on the earth's surface

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standards for Digital Geospatial Metadata
